Topic.Title: French Steel

Message.Msg: Germany's power in Europe is rapidly rising now. The speculator community learned they will not get bailed out as they have been before - their losses could be as high as 40% in the banks of Cyprus, which is good. Also all the useless employees of one bank will be fired - excellent. If Cyprus had been under Bernanke's jurisdiction he would certainly have bailed it out, borrowing whatever he needed to from someone, which is the way the US government runs its entire economy. The US embraces "casino economy" economics. The French have obviously realized that there is only one way: the way of discipline. For most of their history they were that way anyway, so it is not a big change. Germany's economic leaders are not influenced by the pernicious forces that influence American/British ones. Such influences went away quite some time ago. Things will turn out badly for America thanks to its poor policies, but Europe will be there for it. It is going to need much reconstruction at some point...

Topic.Title: higher dividends?

Message.Msg: Very good point! I believe the hindrance to XOM's advancing stock price is demand. Why buy XOM with a 2.6% dividend yield, when you could buy TOT @ 5.5%, BP @ 5.4%, RDS @ 5.3%, or COP @ 4.5%. You would be carrying the same general risks as if you owned XOM.

Message.Title: The upcoming war
Message.Msg: The War Drums are beating... The USA will get to carry almost the entire burden too when it finally comes. Great Britain is almost bankrupt, having followed the idiotic policy of the Federal Reserve, only there its twice as much, and the result is twice as bad. The German army has sent a small force of 400 troops and a patriot missile team to Turkey, but the German soldiers have been treated poorly. When a Turkish officer insulted a German policewoman directing traffic, there as nearly an international incident. The German press was not amused. I doubt France has much to offer... Germany owns very little US Treasury debt, preferring gold, which it is moving to Germany presently. The Chinese and Japanese are your big bankers, having loaned you trillions between them, so maybe they can provide some support... The Chinese do love oil, so many they can be induced. The Imperial Armies of "Rome" march into battle, complete with fasces in their Commander in Chief's office...

Message.Title: The last time Germany went to war against a Muslim power...
Message.Msg: September 1683, and the Schlacht am Kahlenberg, the Battle of Vienna... The forces of the Ottoman Empire were besieging Vienna. It took all summer to marshal the forces for the counter-strike. About 20,000 cavalry were provided by German nobles "Junkers" ruling Poland and Saxony, the Teutonic Knights of the Baltic, and the forces of the Western German nobles of Bavaria. They swept in down the Kahlenberg hill into the Ottoman flank the morning of September 12, 1683 in a surprise attack. A rough reenactment can be seen in J.R.R. Tolkien's Two Towers, in the lifting of the siege (Tolkien's book is full of Germanic themes from end to end) The Ottoman army collapsed, and its Sultan fled east leaving his harem of thousands of women, and mountains of coffee and camp followers to be taken as plunder. The coffee houses of Vienna owe their foundation to the stores of coffee plundered from the Ottomans. The Austrians then then set up a military frontier over the ensuing decades which they pushed east. The garrison towns were thoroughly Germanized. The sons of the local population were taught to speak German, and tutored in German methods of discipline by the Austrians. In time the Ottomans forget any plans they had for controlling the Eastern Europe. By World War I they were a German ally.
